name: 3,4-difluoro-2-methoxybenzoic acid
Reason: The compound 3,4-difluoro-2-methoxybenzoic acid is structurally related to benzoic acid, which has a melting point of 122°C. When considering the melting point shift due to functional groups: Methoxy group (OCH3) is expected to lower the melting point due to its electron-donating effect and introduction of a dipolar moment (-5°C). The fluorine atoms, due to their strong electronegativity and size, would likely increase the melting point; since there are two fluorines, this effect could be roughly +8°C per fluorine atom. The carboxylic acid group generally raises the melting point due to strong hydrogen bonding and dimer formation, and since the molecule already has a carboxylic acid group, we do not consider an additional effect for this group specifically. Combining these effects, the estimated shift due to functional groups would be (+8°C x 2) - 5°C = +11°C
